alert.note: Alert for Seneca; Yates (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:29PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Seneca and northwestern Yates Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 328 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sodus to near Vine Valley. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seneca Falls, Waterloo, Fayette, Benton, Potter, Middlesex, Rushville, Ferguson Corners, Vine Valley and Border City. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 near 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
